Html:
Hi there,

I had installed the WSUS Package Publisher (WPP) into my WSUS Server and had created an Adobe Reader 9.3.3 update with WPP. However, I was unable to allow my client to install this update, despite the console showing "Not Installed". And when I tried to install this update through the console, it displayed a "Fail to copy the file" message. May I know how I can solve this issue, thanks?

Hi,
I was unable to allow my client to install this update, despite the console showing "Not Installed".
If the status is "Not Installed" this mean that clients computers doesn't download the update. Please, verify that the update is approve for installation on this computer group.
Then, on a client computer, trigger a detection (go to control panel, open Windows Update and click on Search for updates). Then go to C:\Windows
and open the file WindowsUpdate.log and look for any error message.

Hi there,

I've verified that the update is approved for installation on the computer group. And as I trigger a detection, I noticed that there was an error in the WindowsUpdate.log below while synchronising updates, despite the Windows Update Client successfully detecting 0 updates. May I know how I can solve this issue, thanks? Anyway, I am presently using Windows Server 2003 OS..

Hi,
are you sure this settings are correct :

2014-04-13 15:59:36:417 888 cd0 PT Initializing simple targeting cookie, clientId = 9f60f430-8127-445a-ac4a-c87b9b1b20de, target group = , DNS name = wsus-main.wsus-int.savant
2014-04-13 15:59:36:417 888 cd0 PT Server URL = __http://153.103.30.22__/SimpleAuthWebService/SimpleAuth.asmx

How many computers are affected ? Does clients computers receive and install Mcrosoft regular updates ?

Hi there,

These settings are correct based on our Export and Import servers. Before installing WPP, our client computers have no problems in receiving and installing Microsoft regular updates. But, I'll be giving my client computers another try to install Microsoft regular updates and will get back to you within this week, as it'll take quite a long time to export & import updates.

You were right in mentioning that my clients computers did not download the updates as I found out from the SoftwareDistribution.log that this update was not verified and downloaded. I realise that the ContentSyncAgent displays the "FileVerified" message and no "FileDownloaded" message. Also, I saw that there was a "File cert verification failed for c:\Program Files\Update Services\autest.cab with 2147942402" message.

Anyway, I got 4 computers displaying "Not Installed" in the WPP console. May I know the reasons for this cause and how I can solve this issue? Thanks for taking the time to help me out.

Hi, WPP can only work if your Wsus infrastructure works properly.
You have to solve your Wsus issue before try to use WPP. Check what have been change on Wsus infrastructure, read WindowsUpdate.log.
